column4: How do I get my mouse working so I can use mouse3,4, and 5 like in windows?
Edit /etc/X/xorg.conf and put the following line in:
Are you running Warty?  If so, it'll be called XFree86-4
And then you might want to consider doing "apt-get dist-upgrade".
That would upgrade your installation to the latest & greatest.  And, perhaps, break something temporarily.
Don't worry about breakage, though.  Just do it. :-)
Try it.  It probably works now.
In the section Section "InputDevice", there should be a line, Option          "ZAxisMapping"          "4 5"
Ah, I don't know.  I've never had such a fancy mouse. :-)
Configure Gnome to not save the current session upon logout.
I don't know.  I don't run Gnome.
